intro: Tetratheca nuda var. spartea, commonly known as the slender tetratheca, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Theaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers. The leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a hairy texture. This variety is distinguished by its reduced bracts and shorter floral structure compared to other varieties of Tetratheca nuda. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open habitats such as heaths and woodlands.
